data.0: No government structure. In many cases, family bonds predominate.
data.1: Company/Corporation. Government by a company managerial elite;  citizens are company employees.
data.2: Participating Democracy. Government by advice and consent of the citizen.
data.3: Self-Perpetuating Oligarchy. Government by a restricted minority, with little or no input from the masses.
data.4: Representative Democracy. Government by elected representatives.
data.5: Feudal Technocracy. Government by specific individuals for those who agree to be ruled. Relationships are based on the performance of technical activities which are mutually beneficial.
data.6: Captive Government. Government by an imposed leadership answerable to an outside group. A colony or conquered area.
data.7: Balkanization. No central ruling authority exists; rival governments compete for control.
data.8: Civil Service Bureaucracy. Government by agencies employing individuals selected for their expertise.
data.9: Impersonal Bureaucracy. Government by agencies which are insulated from the governed.
data.10: Charismatic Dictator. Government by a single leader enjoying the confidence of the citizens.
data.11: Non-Charismatic Leader. A previous charismatic dictatar has been replaced by a leader through normal channels.
data.12: Charismatic Oligarchy. Government by a select group, organization, or class enjoying the overwhelming confidence of the citizenry.
data.13: Religious Dictatorship. Government by a religious organization without regard to the specific needs of the citizenry.
